content.question: All of the following serve as checks on the power of the federal courts EXCEPT:

choices.label: The voters can oust federal judges in national elections.
Congress can pass a law clarifying “legislative intent.”
Presidents, governors, and local executives can refrain from enforcing court rulings.
Congress and the state legislatures can amend the Constitution.

content.answer: The voters can oust federal judges in national elections.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
